00017 package WeBWorK::CourseEnvironment;
00018 
00019 =head1 NAME
00020 
00021 WeBWorK::CourseEnvironment - Read configuration information from global.conf
00022 and course.conf files.
00023 
00024 =head1 SYNOPSIS
00025 
00026  use WeBWorK::CourseEnvironment;
00027  $ce = WeBWorK::CourseEnvironment->new({
00028     webwork_url         => "/webwork2",
00029     webwork_dir         => "/opt/webwork2",
00030     pg_dir              => "/opt/pg",
00031     webwork_htdocs_url  => "/webwork2_files",
00032     webwork_htdocs_dir  => "/opt/webwork2/htdocs",
00033     webwork_courses_url => "/webwork2_course_files",
00034     webwork_courses_dir => "/opt/webwork2/courses",
00035     courseName          => "name_of_course",
00036  });
00037  
00038  my $timeout = $courseEnv->{sessionKeyTimeout};
00039  my $mode    = $courseEnv->{pg}->{options}->{displayMode};
00040  # etc...
00041 
00042 =head1 DESCRIPTION
00043 
00044 The WeBWorK::CourseEnvironment module reads the system-wide F<global.conf> and
00045 course-specific F<course.conf> files used by WeBWorK to calculate and store
00046 settings needed throughout the system. The F<.conf> files are perl source files
00047 that can contain any code allowed under the default safe compartment opset.
00048 After evaluation of both files, any package variables are copied out of the
00049 safe compartment into a hash. This hash becomes the course environment.
00050 
00051 =cut
00052 
00053 use strict;
00054 use warnings;
00055 use Carp;
00056 use WWSafe;
00057 use WeBWorK::Utils qw(readFile);
00058 use WeBWorK::Debug;
00059 use Opcode qw(empty_opset);
00060 
00061 =head1 CONSTRUCTION
00062 
00063 =over
00064 
00065 =item new(HASHREF)
00066 
00067 HASHREF is a reference to a hash containing scalar variables with which to seed
00068 the course environment. It must contain at least a value for the key
00069 C<webworkRoot>.
00070 
00071 The C<new> method finds the file F<conf/global.conf> relative to the given
00072 C<webwork_dir> directory. After reading this file, it uses the
00073 C<$courseFiles{environment}> variable, if present, to locate the course
00074 environment file. If found, the file is read and added to the environment.
00075 
00076 =item new(ROOT URLROOT PGROOT COURSENAME)
00077 
00078 A deprecated form of the constructor in which four seed variables are given
00079 explicitly: C<webwork_dir>, C<webwork_url>, C<pg_dir>, and C<courseName>.
00080 
00081 =cut
00082 
00083 # NEW SYNTAX
00084 # 
00085 # new($invocant, $seedVarsRef)
00086 #   $invocant       implicitly set by caller
00087 #   $seedVarsRef    reference to hash containing scalar variables with which to
00088 #                   seed the course environment
00089 # 
00090 # OLD SYNTAX
00091 # 
00092 # new($invocant, $webworkRoot, $webworkURLRoot, $pgRoot, $courseName)
00093 #   $invocant          implicitly set by caller
00094 #   $webworkRoot       directory that contains the WeBWorK distribution
00095 #   $webworkURLRoot    URL that points to the WeBWorK system
00096 #   $pgRoot            directory that contains the PG distribution
00097 #   $courseName        name of the course being used
00098 sub new {
00099     my ($invocant, @rest) = @_;
00100     my $class = ref($invocant) || $invocant;
00101     
00102     # contains scalar symbols/values with which to seed course environment
00103     my %seedVars;
00104     
00105     # where do we get the seed variables?
00106     if (ref $rest[0] eq "HASH") {
00107         %seedVars = %{$rest[0]};
00108     } else {
00109         debug __PACKAGE__, ": deprecated four-argument form of new() used.\n";
00110         $seedVars{webwork_dir}    = $rest[0];
00111         $seedVars{webwork_url}    = $rest[1];
00112         $seedVars{pg_dir}         = $rest[2];
00113         $seedVars{courseName}     = $rest[3];
00114     }
00115     
00116     my $safe = WWSafe->new;
00117     
00118     # seed course environment with initial values
00119     while (my ($var, $val) = each %seedVars) {
00120         $val = "" if not defined $val;
00121         $safe->reval("\$$var = '$val';");
00122     }
00123     
00124     # Compile the "include" function with all opcodes available.
00125     my $include = q[ sub include {
00126         my ($file) = @_;
00127         my $fullPath = "].$seedVars{webwork_dir}.q[/$file";
00128         # This regex matches any string that begins with "../",
00129         # ends with "/..", contains "/../", or is "..".
00130         if ($fullPath =~ m!(?:^|/)\.\.(?:/|$)!) {
00131             die "Included file $file has potentially insecure path: contains \"..\"";
00132         } else {
00133             local @INC = ();
00134             my $result = do $fullPath;
00135             if ($!) {
00136                 warn "Failed to read include file $fullPath (has it been created from the corresponding .dist file?): $!";
00137             } elsif ($@) {
00138                 warn "Failed to compile include file $fullPath: $@";
00139             } elsif (not $result) {
00140                 warn "Include file $fullPath did not return a true value.";
00141             }
00142         }
00143     } ];
00144     
00145     my $maskBackup = $safe->mask;
00146     $safe->mask(empty_opset);
00147     $safe->reval($include);
00148     $@ and die "Failed to reval include subroutine: $@";
00149     $safe->mask($maskBackup);
00150     
00151     # determine location of globalEnvironmentFile
00152     my $globalEnvironmentFile;
00153     if (-r "$seedVars{webwork_dir}/conf/global.conf") {
00154         $globalEnvironmentFile = "$seedVars{webwork_dir}/conf/global.conf";
00155     } elsif (-r "$seedVars{webwork_dir}/conf/global.conf.dist") { # default version
00156         $globalEnvironmentFile = "$seedVars{webwork_dir}/conf/global.conf.dist";
00157     }       
00158     
00159     # read and evaluate the global environment file
00160     my $globalFileContents = readFile($globalEnvironmentFile);
00161     $safe->reval($globalFileContents);
00162     
00163     # if that evaluation failed, we can't really go on...
00164     # we need a global environment!
00165     $@ and croak "Could not evaluate global environment file $globalEnvironmentFile: $@";
00166     
00167     # determine location of courseEnvironmentFile and simple configuration file
00168     # pull it out of $safe's symbol table ad hoc
00169     # (we don't want to do the hash conversion yet)
00170     no strict 'refs';
00171     my $courseEnvironmentFile = ${*{${$safe->root."::"}{courseFiles}}}{environment};
00172     my $courseWebConfigFile = $seedVars{web_config_filename} ||
00173         ${*{${$safe->root."::"}{courseFiles}}}{simpleConfig};
00174     use strict 'refs';
00175     
00176     # read and evaluate the course environment file
00177     # if readFile failed, we don't bother trying to reval
00178     my $courseFileContents = eval { readFile($courseEnvironmentFile) }; # catch exceptions
00179     $@ or $safe->reval($courseFileContents);
00180     my $courseWebConfigContents = eval { readFile($courseWebConfigFile) }; # catch exceptions
00181     $@ or $safe->reval($courseWebConfigContents);
00182     
00183     # get the safe compartment's namespace as a hash
00184     no strict 'refs';
00185     my %symbolHash = %{$safe->root."::"};
00186     use strict 'refs';
00187     
00188     # convert the symbol hash into a hash of regular variables.
00189     my $self = {};
00190     foreach my $name (keys %symbolHash) {
00191         # weed out internal symbols
00192         next if $name =~ /^(INC|_.*|__ANON__|main::)$/;
00193         # pull scalar, array, and hash values for this symbol
00194         my $scalar = ${*{$symbolHash{$name}}};
00195         my @array = @{*{$symbolHash{$name}}};
00196         my %hash = %{*{$symbolHash{$name}}};
00197         # for multiple variables sharing a symbol, scalar takes precedence
00198         # over array, which takes precedence over hash.
00199         if (defined $scalar) {
00200             $self->{$name} = $scalar;
00201         } elsif (@array) {
00202             $self->{$name} = \@array;
00203         } elsif (%hash) {
00204             $self->{$name} = \%hash;
00205         }
00206     }
00207     
00208     bless $self, $class;
00209     
00210     # here is where we can do evil things to the course environment *sigh*
00211     # anything changed has to be done here. after this, CE is considered read-only
00212     # anything added must be prefixed with an underscore.
00213     
00214     # create reverse-lookup hash mapping status abbreviations to real names
00215     $self->{_status_abbrev_to_name} = {
00216         map { my $name = $_; map { $_ => $name } @{$self->{statuses}{$name}{abbrevs}} }
00217             keys %{$self->{statuses}}
00218     };
00219     
00220     # now that we're done, we can go ahead and return...
00221     return $self;
00222 }
00223 
00224 =back
00225 
00226 =head1 ACCESS
00227 
00228 There are no formal accessor methods. However, since the course environemnt is
00229 a hash of hashes and arrays, is exists as the self hash of an instance
00230 variable:
00231 
00232     $ce->{someKey}{someOtherKey};
00233 
00234 =head1 EXPERIMENTAL ACCESS METHODS
00235 
00236 This is an experiment in extending CourseEnvironment to know a little more about
00237 its contents, and perform useful operations for me.
00238 
00239 There is a set of operations that require certain data from the course
00240 environment. Most of these are un Utils.pm. I've been forced to pass $ce into
00241 them, so that they can get their data out. But some things are so intrinsically
00242 linked to the course environment that they might as well be methods in this
00243 class.
00244 
00245 =head2 STATUS METHODS
00246 
00247 =over
00248 
00249 =item status_abbrev_to_name($status_abbrev)
00250 
00251 Given the abbreviation for a status, return the name. Returns undef if the
00252 abbreviation is not found.
00253 
00254 =cut
00255 
00256 sub status_abbrev_to_name {
00257     my ($ce, $status_abbrev) = @_;
00258     if (not defined $status_abbrev or $status_abbrev eq "") {
00259         carp "status_abbrev_to_name: status_abbrev (first argument) must be defined and non-empty";
00260         return;
00261     }
00262     
00263     return $ce->{_status_abbrev_to_name}{$status_abbrev};
00264 }
00265 
00266 =item status_name_to_abbrevs($status_name)
00267 
00268 Returns the list of abbreviations for a given status. Returns an empty list if
00269 the status is not found.
00270 
00271 =cut
00272 
00273 sub status_name_to_abbrevs {
00274     my ($ce, $status_name) = @_;
00275     if (not defined $status_name or $status_name eq "") {
00276         carp "status_name_to_abbrevs: status_name (first argument) must be defined and non-empty";
00277         return;
00278     }
00279     
00280     return unless exists $ce->{statuses}{$status_name};
00281     return @{$ce->{statuses}{$status_name}{abbrevs}};
00282 }
00283 
00284 =item status_has_behavior($status_name, $behavior)
00285 
00286 Return true if $status_name lists $behavior.
00287 
00288 =cut
00289 
00290 sub status_has_behavior {
00291     my ($ce, $status_name, $behavior) = @_;
00292     if (not defined $status_name or $status_name eq "") {
00293         carp "status_has_behavior: status_name (first argument) must be defined and non-empty";
00294         return;
00295     }
00296     if (not defined $behavior or $behavior eq "") {
00297         carp "status_has_behavior: behavior (second argument) must be defined and non-empty";
00298         return;
00299     }
00300     
00301     if (exists $ce->{statuses}{$status_name}) {
00302         if (exists $ce->{statuses}{$status_name}{behaviors}) {
00303             my $num_matches = grep { $_ eq $behavior } @{$ce->{statuses}{$status_name}{behaviors}};
00304             return $num_matches > 0;
00305         } else {
00306             return 0; # no behaviors
00307         }
00308     } else {
00309         warn "status '$status_name' not found in \%statuses -- assuming no behaviors.\n";
00310         return 0;
00311     }
00312 }
00313 
00314 =item status_abbrev_has_behavior($status_abbrev, $behavior)
00315 
00316 Return true if the status abbreviated by $status_abbrev lists $behavior.
00317 
00318 =cut
00319 
00320 sub status_abbrev_has_behavior {
00321     my ($ce, $status_abbrev, $behavior) = @_;
00322     if (not defined $status_abbrev or $status_abbrev eq "") {
00323         carp "status_abbrev_has_behavior: status_abbrev (first argument) must be defined and non-empty";
00324         return;
00325     }
00326     if (not defined $behavior or $behavior eq "") {
00327         carp "status_abbrev_has_behavior: behavior (second argument) must be defined and non-empty";
00328         return;
00329     }
00330     
00331     my $status_name = $ce->status_abbrev_to_name($status_abbrev);
00332     if (defined $status_name) {
00333         return $ce->status_has_behavior($status_name, $behavior);
00334     } else {
00335         warn "status abbreviation '$status_abbrev' not found in \%statuses -- assuming no behaviors.\n";
00336     }
00337 }
00338 
00339 =back
00340 
00341 =cut
00342 
00343 1;
